p: Céspedes et al. [ 66] accomplished bioactivity-guided isolation, in which heartwood parts of C. dugesii were extracted with CH 2Cl 2 against two monocots seeds. The authors were able to verify the most active fraction (F3— L. multiflorum = IC 50 24.0 μg/mL; T. vulgare = IC 50 23.0 μg/mL) and to arrive at the compound responsible for the activity, which was an epimeric mixture of compounds 177 and 178.
